purpose: This Code of Conduct outlines the expectations for professional behavior at NovaTech. All employees, contractors, and partners are expected to uphold these standards to promote a safe, respectful, and ethical work environment.
scope: This policy applies to all NovaTech employees, regardless of position or location.

respect_integrity.description: Treat all individuals with dignity, respect, and fairness
specifics: Foster a workplace free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation
Encourage open and honest communication
Value diversity and inclusion

professional_behavior.description: Maintain professionalism in all communications and interactions
specifics: Dress appropriately for the workplace or client meetings
Avoid gossip, slander, or disrespectful behavior
Be punctual for meetings and commitments

compliance.description: Abide by all applicable laws and company policies
specifics: Follow all internal policies and procedures
Report any known or suspected violations
Complete all mandatory trainings

confidentiality.description: Protect sensitive company and client information
specifics: Do not disclose confidential data without authorization
Use secure methods for sharing sensitive information
Protect intellectual property and trade secrets

conflict_of_interest.description: Avoid situations that could compromise impartiality
specifics: Disclose any potential conflicts immediately
Do not engage in competing business activities
Do not accept gifts over â‚¹2,000 from vendors
Use assets primarily for work-related purposes
Do not use resources for illegal activities
Be mindful of excessive personal use
Follow all safety protocols
Report unsafe conditions immediately
Support a drug-free workplace

social_media.description: Be responsible when representing the company online
specifics: Do not share confidential information
Make clear when expressing personal opinions
Be respectful in all online interactions

reporting.non_retaliation: NovaTech prohibits retaliation against anyone who reports concerns in good faith

acknowledgment.process: All employees must sign an acknowledgment during onboarding
